thread.title: Macquarie halted as Esanda buy looms
thread.title_full: Macquarie halted as Esanda buy looms | Business Spectator

author: Mitchell Neems and Gretchen Friemann
title: Macquarie halted as Esanda buy looms
text:
Shares in Macquarie Group have been placed in a trading halt pending an announcement to the market, widely tipped to be confirmation it will acquire ANZ’s car financing division, Esanda.
"Macquarie Group expects to make an announcement to the ASX in relation to a proposed transaction and update to short term outlook," the statement said.
DataRoom earlier reported Macquarie was poised to launch a $400m institutional placement to support the buy, to be carried out by Macquarie, JPMorgan and Bank of America Merrill Lynch
It is expected to be accompanied by a share purchase plan.
Macquarie has long been viewed as the logical acquirer of the business but its pursuit was temporarily halted by the competition watchdog, the ACCC, which carried out an assessment of the impact of the deal.
In September, the ACCC greenlighted the purchase, paving the way for today’s transaction.
